Posts.Content: wbts wrote: Hello.  I have been trying to not post until I know something for sure but I am getting too concerned to not post.  For the last couple weeks my left breast has been causing me pain.  Nothing extreme, just pain, sometimes stabbing and being able to feel my left breast...  The breast is tender ( part of which may be because I'm contantly checking it).  I also have a lump at 4 o'clock which I and the PA I saw are guessing is either a lymph node or scar tissue from a previous benign lump I've had removed. It's tender. I went in to have my breast checked yesterday.  She scheduled me Monday for a mammogram, ultrasound or both, whichever the radiologist prefers. Now tonight there are more lumps, I'm assuming lymph nodes at 1 and 2 o'clock.   My fear is IBC due to not really feeling a lump in the breast. Breast cancer at all is my fear.  Any ideas on why my lymph nodes on just one side would be flaring up?  My mom had breast cancer at around age 60, she is a survivor...yay!!!   I'm 32 with 2 boys. The youngest is 8 and I breastfed both.   Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: wbts wrote: I'm back with more problems on the same side as last time I posted..  For the past month I have been having more issues. Started with a very sore armpit.  Generally achiness in my armpit and sometimes shooting or stabbing pains when I would move my shoulder.  My armpit was swollen to the point where I could still shave but not well and had to be careful.  I have let myself run through a menstral cycle and most of the swelling is gone.  It isn't nearly as painful. But, I still have multiple swollen nodes and it's sore.  Maybe it's sore just from me touching it to check the are.  I just ahve swollen, what I believe to be nodes on the one side.  My breasts are so lumpy that I dont' know if the lumps are all still just fibroademas...  Anyone experience anything like this??  I feel like maybe I should just wait longer but then again I know early diagnosis is key.  I just had a diagnostic mammogram and an ultrasound in I believe November.  Very dense breast but everything looked okay and they just wanted me back in a year.  My mom had breast cancer but she was post menopause when she got it. Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2009 03:18PM wbts wrote: Thanks for your responses.   So I went to the dr.  Literally less than 5 minutes with doc.  he didnt' even feel my breast...didn't even look.  he left the gown over me, felt my armpit for MAYBE 30-45 seconds and said it's not breast cancer. I was too chicken to ask him to just feel my breasts for me, I just thought he would.  I feel like he was just thinking I was overreacting. No explanation, no nothing.  At first, before he was talking to me I was explaining that my nodes have been swollen for a month and he said 'it's probably an infected sweat duct. I knew it wasn't that. He did say 'well, it's not that'.  He also told me that cancerous lumps dont' hurt.  I said 'well, my mom had breast cancer and hers did.'  He acted shocked.  I'm such a moron! Why didn't I just ask him to feel my breasts.  I didnt' expect those lumps are cancer I just wonder what's making my nodes be swolllen!! He said he's really good and know what lumps are cancer and what aren't. How does he know if he doesn't feel my boobs!!!

Posts.Content: wbts wrote: I'm back.  A few months ago I posted regarding lumps in my left breast and pain. Went to the Dr. and had diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound.  I was told I have very dense breasts  (also very small) and the Dr. that reads the mammogram said he was 99% sure it was nothing and to come back in a year. I just have fibroadenomas.  This all was in I think Nov-Dec. So now for a little over a month I have been having pains in my left breast.  Some times it's just an ache that is constant and sometimes it's a shooting pain. But the achey pain feels almost like it's bruised and is sore to the touch as well. I do not feel a lump there..just the same lumps on the outer quandrants of the breast towards the armpit.  What I'm concerned about now is last night when I was getting out of the bath I looked in the mirror and at first I thought it was a bruise so I showed my husband and we think it's a vein.  It's blue and over the spot that always hurts.  Is this worth going back to the dr. for after having tests just a few months ago?  Any thoughts?  Thanks Log in to post a reply
